name: getall-automation-stats
description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve stats for all your Automations.**

By default, all of your Automations will be returned, but you can specify a selection by passing in a comma-separated list of Automation IDs as the value of the query string parameter `automation_ids`.

Responses are paginated. You can limit the number of responses returned per batch using the `page_size` query string parameter. The default is 50, but you specify a value between 1 and 100.

You can retrieve a specific page of responses with the `page_token` query string parameter.

automation_ids.description: This endpoint returns all automation IDs if no `automation_ids` are specified.

page_size.description: The number of elements you want returned on each page.

page_token.description: The stats endpoints are paginated. To get the next page, call the passed `_metadata.next` URL. If `_metadata.prev` doesn't exist, you're at the first page. Similarly, if `_metadata.next` is not present, you're at the last page.

$ul: **count**: The number of items in the entire list, i.e., across all pages.
**next**: The URL of the next page of results. If this field isn't present, you're at the end of the list.
**prev**: The URL of the previous page of results. If this field isn't present, you're at the start of the list.
**self**: The URL of the current page of results.
